title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.21 | 07-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम ज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्रीगुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने

directed by the interaction of the three modes of material nature set in action by the Lord and therefore it is said here that the Lord existed before the modes of material nature was set in motion so before this creation Lord existed as Krishna in his various forms all the forms Lord Krishna Rama Narasimha Vraha Narayana Vishnu they always exist in that particular eternal form

Informed in the Shruti Mantra, in the Vedas, original Vedas, that only Vishnu, the Supreme Lord, existed before the creation and there was no Brahma, no Shiva, no demigods.
Vishnu means the Mahavishnu who is lying on the causal ocean. There is one causal ocean, Karana Jala.
And there, one form of Vishnu, the first form of Vishnu, Mahavishnu, he is lying there and he is breathing and by his breathing, the universes are coming out of his body in the form of seeds.
And these seed-like universes, very, very tiny, they develop gradually into huge universe.
And within that universe, there will be universe.
There will be innumerable planets in each and every universe.
Now, how do they develop? Prabhupada gives a very nice example.
Just like a very, very, very small banyan seed, seed of a banyan tree, very tiny, it's like a pinhead, it's very, very small.
That, when planted in a fertile ground, it will develop into huge universe.
A huge banyan tree that can spread over hundreds of square kilometers.
So, like that, Mahavishnu breathes out universes in very, very, very tiny seed-like form.
But each of them develops into huge, gigantic universe with millions of planets.
Each planet, millions of living entities.
So, this Mahavishnu is described in the Brahma Samhita as a plenary portion of Krishna.
In the Brahma Samhita it is said,
Let me offer my respectful obeisances unto the original personality of Godhead, Govinda, whose plenary portion is Mahavishnu.
All the Brahmas, the heads of the universes, live only for the period of his exhaling after universes are generated from the pores of his transcendental body.
That Mahavishnu breathes out universes in seed-like form.
And they'll remain only as long as, after his breathing out, for some time, he is not inhaling.
So, he, after he exhales, little time, then he inhales.
So, that tiny duration between his exhalation and inhalation,
that is the duration of the life of Brahma.
For us, how long is that period?
The lifespan of Brahma, according to our calculation.
So, the interval between the exhalation, outgoing breath of Mahavishnu,
This is not even the complete breathing cycle of Mahavishnu.
It is the intervening time between his exhalation and inhalation.
So, try to understand how great is God.
Just this alone can help you understand.
and they are all Him only.
who is actually the origin of this universe,
who breathes in and breathes out,

here is the original personality of Godhead.

the merging of the living entities in the body of Mahavishnu or Garbhodakshaya Vishnu,
does not mean the living being is the only being.
Does not mean the living being is the only being.

we are ultimately devotees of Krishna.
